text: Ladhabhai Nakum Amar Singh (4 December 1910 â€“ 21 May 1940) was an Indian cricketer. His full name was Ladhabhai Nakum Amar Singh Lodha. He was a right arm fast bowler and an effective lower order batsman. Amar Singh was the first Indian to receive a Test cap. He was born in Rajkot, Gujarat on 4 December 1910. Amar Singh played for the Indian cricket team, Hindus cricket team and various teams in the first class cricket matches. He took 28 wickets and scored 292 runs in 7 Test cricket matches, playing for the Indian cricket team. Amar Singh died due to typhoid on May 21 1940 in Jamnagar, Gujarat. ==References== Category:Indian cricketers Category:1910 births Category:1940 deaths
